result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ae] case called 01:43 PM Defendant Joseph M Connolly appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Barteck (PD appears for bond-purposes only). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Right to Counsel given
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence 
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at Victim 1's residence, with the exception that defendant may return one time with law enforcement to retrieve personal items. If that takes longer than 15- 20 minutes, defendant is to arrange for an off duty officer at his own expense. Defendant is to only take items that are undisputetly his
--maintain absolute sobriety 

The Court orders the defendant to provide COC with alternate address no later than the end of the week

recess 1:52 pm. 
NEXT: (1) Adjourned IA on 7/18/22 at 2:00 pm with in person appearances [Clerk to send PFAC with bond to jail]
